data.title: generation NBA players
data.text:
Father Son(s) Notes Ref. • Rick and Brent are the second father-son duo to win NBA championships as players

• Rick, Jon and Brent all played for and ended their playing career with the Houston Rockets

• Rick, Jon and Drew all played for the Golden State Warriors [1] • Both played for the New York Knicks [2] • Both played against Kobe Bryant and Kevin Garnett during their respective careers [3] • Both played for the Chicago Bulls [4] • Both played for the New York Knicks.

• Rick serves as a Knicks assistant coach, while Jalen plays for New York. [5] [6] • Wayne played in the ABA [2] [2] • Both played for the Utah Jazz [7] Both Dell and Seth played for the Charlotte Hornets [8] Dale Davis Trayce Jackson-Davis • Both played for the Golden State Warriors [9][10] [11] [12] [2] [13] • Rich played in the ABA [2] • Both played for the Milwaukee Bucks

• Mike Sr. & Mike Jr. are the second father/son coach/player pairing to compete against each other in an NBA game [14] [2] [15] [2] [16] • Harvey Grant's identical twin brother, , also played in the NBA [16] [2] • Matt Sr. and Matt Jr. are the first father-son duo to win NBA championships as players [17] • Both played for the Dallas Mavericks and became teammates with Dirk Nowitzki during their careers. [18] [2] • Earle played in the ABA [2] [19] [2] • Bill Sr. played in the NBL [2] [2] • George & Coby are the third father/son coach/player pairing to compete against each other in an NBA game [20] [21] [2] • Both played for the Houston Rockets [22] [2] [23] [24] • Both played for the Los Angeles Lakers [25] [2] • Both played for the New York Knicks [2] [2] • Pete played in the NBL [2] [26] • All 3 played for Cleveland Cavaliers [16] [27] • Both played for the Milwaukee Bucks and Los Angeles Lakers

• Payton and Payton II are the fifth father-son duo to win NBA championships as players

[28][29] [30] [31] • Walt played in the ABA [2] [32] [33] [18] • Doc & Austin are the fourth father/son coach/player pairing to compete against each other in an NBA game

• Austin is the first son to play for his father in an NBA game [34][35] [16] • Both started their playing career with the Detroit Pistons [36] • Al played in the ABA [2] [2] [37] [38] • Both played for the Utah Jazz [39] • Walter played in the ABA [2] [40] • Collis played in the ABA

• Both played for the San Antonio Spurs [41] • Mychal and Klay are the fourth father-son duo to win NBA championships as players [42] • In 1998, Gary Trent was traded from the Portland Trail Blazers to the Toronto Raptors 41 games into his third season.

• 23 years later, Gary Trent Jr. was also traded from the Portland Trail Blazers to the Toronto Raptors 41 games into his third season [43] • Butch & Jan are the first father/son coach/player pairing to compete against each other in an NBA game [14][44] • David Jr. played in the ABA [2] [2] [2] [45] [11]
